conclusion: Analyze forces, use velocity-time relationship, apply kinetic friction concept to find coefficient.
Block of mass m on horizontal plate of mass M, subject to normal force and kinetic friction; velocity-time relationship shown.
Acceleration a is determined from velocity-time relationship as a = 2 m/s^2.
Net force on block and plate is f_k = upmu_1 mg, where f_k is kinetic friction force.
Acceleration a is expressed as a = upmu_1 g / 2 using kinetic friction equation.
Solve for upmu_1: upmu_1 = 0.4 using a = 2 m/s^2.
Coefficient of kinetic friction between block and plate is 0.4.
